result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Bonds continued.
Pre-trial conference scheduled for July 21, 2022 at 10:15 am.
Review hearing scheduled for August 17, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant is ordered to report to pretrial monitoring immediately after court and must comply with pretrial
monitoring conditions.
Not to possess or consume any illegal drugs,
Not to possess any drug paraphernalia.
Not to possess syringes unless medically required.
Not to possess or consume any prescription drugs not prescribed.
Not to associate with anyone involved in illegal drug activities,
Defendant shall not drive without a valid driver's license.

Prosecuting attorney Scott Zehr in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant STEPHANIE KAE HARSHMAN appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Nicholis J Schroeder appeared by video for STEPHANIE KAE HARSHMAN.
